author: prestonvanloon
content: Hey <@!550420431744794624>, We'd like to get your thoughts on something. We're looking at a keystore storage format that would allow multiple keys to be encrypted in the same keystore. We're noticing that scrypt is allocating 1gb of memory to decrypt 64 keys with the params set in EIP-2335. What do you think would be the best approach?

author: prestonvanloon
content: We're also starting to get user feedback that using the same mnemonic to derive the withdrawal key and validating hot keys is a security risk. I have raised this concern before and now we are starting to see users report the same thing. I haven't engaged in the EIP process before, but what would it take to propose an edit to https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2334 ?

author: collin.myersobolnetwork
content: <@399309815517544451> what is a greater risk in your eyes theft or loss?

author: prestonvanloon
content: My concern is that I have to effectively bring my cold wallet out of cold storage to derive my hot validating keys if i ever lost them. This has inherent and unnecessary risk to the user. Having a different recovery mnemonic for cold storage means that I only ever need to access this data in the event that I want to use my withdrawal wallet and prevents a total loss via theft if someone were to gain access to my hot key mnemonic.
